abstract: Austria's Parliament issues law banning foreign funding for country's Islamic organizations and requiring that Muslim groups use standardized German translation of Quran; dictate, seen as offensive by some Muslims, is grudgingly accepted.
lead_paragraph: Parliament on Wednesday passed a law that seeks to regulate how Islam is administered, singling out Austria’s Muslim minority for treatment not applied to any other religious group.

headline.main: Austria: Law Tightens Rules for Muslims
headline.print_headline: Austria: Law Tightens Rules for Muslims

snippet: Parliament on Wednesday passed a law that seeks to regulate how Islam is administered, singling out Austria’s Muslim minority for treatment not applied to any other religious group.
